Key Arguments: Censorship during the COVID-19 pandemic prevented open discussion and debate.
Fact checkers lacked transparency and accountability, and potentially had vested interests.
Distinguished experts were censored and de-platformed, which hindered the dissemination of important scientific information.
Government and health authorities allegedly lied and manipulated information during the pandemic.
Censorship led to economic harm and societal fear, and prevented people from accessing alternative health information.
Main Themes: Censorship and its impact on democracy
Lack of transparency and accountability in fact-checking
Misinformation and disinformation during the COVID-19 pandemic
Economic and social consequences of censorship
The importance of open debate and access to diverse information
Notable Quotes: Democracy ends when censorship controls free discussion!
The Government COVID propaganda response is the best example of why censorship should never be permitted.
Our Governments and health authorities constantly lied to us through Covid.
